rasa_properties

 • Ayurveda identifies 6 rasas (tastes). Each rasa influences Vata / Pitta /
 Kapha, digestion, and therapeutic use. # Use this file for:
 • Dosha-safe food suggestions
 • Kadha substitutions
 • Flavor-compatible replacements
 • Explaining why something aggravates or reduces a dosha

1. SWEET (Madhura)

Primary effects

 • Builds tissues, nourishing, grounding
 • Cooling for Pitta
 • Stable for Vata
 • Heavy for Kapha

Increases

 • Kapha (most)
 • Body weight
 • Mucus

Decreases

 • Pitta (heat)
 • Vata (dryness, anxiety)

Common sources

 • Rice, wheat, milk, ghee, dates, banana, sweet potato, jaggery (moderate).

Use cases

 • Vata calming
 • Pitta cooling
 • Avoid for Kapha in excess

2. SOUR (Amla)

Primary effects

 • Stimulates digestion

 1

• Warming
 • Moistening

Increases

 • Pitta (heat)
 • Kapha (mucus slightly)

Decreases

 • Vata

Common sources

 • Yogurt, lemon, tamarind, fermented foods, tomatoes.

Use cases

 • Boost digestion in Vata
 • Reduce dryness
 • Limit for Pitta acidity / Kapha congestion

3. SALTY (Lavana)

Primary effects

 • Warming
 • Increases water retention
 • Enhances taste and digestion

Increases

 • Pitta
 • Kapha (water retention)

Decreases

 • Vata (helps grounding)

Common sources

 • Rock salt, sea salt, pickles, salted snacks.

 2

Use cases

 • Helps Vata digestion
 • Avoid for Pitta (heat)
 • Avoid for Kapha (swelling, BP)

4. BITTER (Tikta)

Primary effects

 • Cooling
 • Detoxifying
 • Reduces cravings

Increases

 • Vata (drying)

Decreases

 • Pitta (best)
 • Kapha (best)

Common sources

 • Neem, methi, karela, spinach, turmeric.

Use cases

 • Best for Pitta heat
 • Best for Kapha detox
 • Use minimally for Vata

5. PUNGENT (Katu)

Primary effects

 • Strongly warming
 • Improves metabolism
 • Clears channels

 3

Increases

 • Pitta strongly
 • Vata moderately (drying)

Decreases

 • Kapha (best)

Common sources

 • Ginger, black pepper, mustard, garlic, chilies.

Use cases

 • Kapha digestion + fat-cutting
 • Avoid for Pitta acidity
 • Limit for Vata (dryness)

6. ASTRINGENT (Kashaya)

Primary effects

 • Cooling
 • Drying
 • Absorbs moisture

Increases

 • Vata (dryness)

Decreases

 • Pitta (heat)
 • Kapha (mucus)

Common sources

 • Beans, lentils, pomegranate, green tea, cranberries.

 4

Use cases

 • Useful for Pitta and Kapha
 • Avoid excess for Vata (gas, bloating)

Quick Dosha–Rasa Summary Table Rasa Vata Pitta Kapha Sweet ↓↓↑Sour ↓
↑↑Salty ↓↑↑Bitter ↑↓↓Pungent ↑↑↓Astringent↑↓↓

(↓= pacifies, ↑= aggravates) ## Usage in substitutions # Sweet alternative
for Pitta

Instead of neem kadha (bitter), give:

 • Coriander water
 • Rose infusion
 • Gulkand + warm water

Kapha-friendly sweeteners

 • Stevia
 • Small jaggery
 • Honey (warm ONLY)

Vata-safe pungent substitute

 • Mild ginger instead of chili
 • Hing instead of garlic

Non-sour options for Pitta

 • Cucumber, coconut, coriander, ripe mango (small)
